title: Look inside this newly renovated Lake Winnipesaukee resort
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mill Falls Resort Collection in Meredith, N.H., completed a comprehensive renovation of its four buildings, including Chase House and Palmer Inn.
Chase House offers 21 revamped rooms with fireplaces and balconies, while Palmer Inn features rooms with a 40-foot waterfall view.
The resort provides amenities including six restaurants, pools, a spa, and year-round activities like yoga, hiking, and kayaking.

title: Boston to spend $135 million in taxpayer dollars for White Stadium overhaul, Wu says
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston will invest $135 million of taxpayer money for White Stadium renovations, up from a $91 million estimate.
Boston Legacy FC will contribute $190 million and over $252 million in community benefits for the stadium project.
Opposition groups have appealed to the Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, citing legal issues with park usage.

title: Where will ‘underdog’ Patriots fans watch the Super Bowl in Seattle?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Patriots fans in Seattle will watch the Super Bowl at Shawn O'Donnell's Irish Pub after challenges securing a venue.
Bar Harbor in Seattle, owned by a Maine native and Pats fan, couldn't staff their venue for the Patriots watch party.
Shawn O'Donnell's will serve Patriots-themed drinks and donate proceeds to the Jimmy Fund, a Boston charity.

title: Waymo wants to expand into Boston. Massachusetts law isn’t ready.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Waymo is seeking to expand its autonomous vehicle operations to Boston, contingent on state legislative approval.
State Rep. Dan Cahill has proposed legislation to establish a framework for autonomous vehicles in Massachusetts.
Critics worry about Waymo's ability to navigate Boston's streets and the potential impact on rideshare and taxi drivers.

title: Why Justin Herbert MVP voter picked Chargers QB over Drake Maye, Matthew Stafford
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Justin Herbert received one of 50 first-place MVP votes, affecting the close vote result between Drake Maye and Matthew Stafford.
Pro Football Focus' Sam Monson voted for Herbert, citing his performance despite playing with the NFL's worst-ranked offensive line.
Matthew Stafford led the league in touchdown passes (46) and yards (4,707), securing the MVP award over Maye and Herbert.

title: Not Your Average Joe’s to close Watertown location after 27 years
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Not Your Average Joe’s in Watertown closing on February 11 after nearly 30 years at 55 Main St.
Watertown closure follows the December 2025 shutdown of the chain’s Peabody location.
The restaurant chain still operates locations in Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, Pennsylvania, Maryland, and Virginia.

title: The best movies on Netflix right now (February 2026)
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix offers over 3,500 films, featuring new originals and classics sorted by genre for easy navigation.
'Ex Machina' and 'Hell or High Water' lead the list of top Netflix movies in February 2026.
'You’ve Got Mail,' 'Erin Brockovich,' and 'The Irishman' are highlighted as must-watch titles currently on Netflix.

title: Ayer man accused in racist confrontation hit with new charges tied to boat vandalism
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: David McPartlan, accused of a racist confrontation, faces new charges for allegedly ordering vandalism on the victim's boat.
McPartlan allegedly directed an employee to destroy the boat's engine with a sledgehammer, promising $500 payment.
After violating a no-contact order, McPartlan's bail was revoked, and he is held at Worcester County House of Correction.

title: This is the top Super Bowl snack in Massachusetts, according to Coffeeness
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Buffalo chicken dip is the most-searched Super Bowl snack in Massachusetts, according to Coffeeness analysis.
Coffeeness found buffalo chicken dip ranked No. 1 nationwide, leading searches in 31 states.
Pico de gallo tops searches for healthy Super Bowl snacks in Massachusetts, Coffeeness reports.

title: Trump isn’t making a Super Bowl pick, but his press secretary isn’t staying impartial: ‘Go Patriots!’
author: John Waller
bullets: President Trump is abstaining from making a Super Bowl LX prediction, per his press secretary Karoline Leavitt.
White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt supports the Patriots, expressing her allegiance during a Thursday briefing.
Trump will not attend the Super Bowl, opting for an interview with NBC's Tom Llamas to air before the game.
